Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2010 10:50PM karen43 wrote: In Oct. 2008 I had just gotten home from the hospital after having a total knee replacement when I received a letter saying my annual screening mammogram was abnormal.  2 needle core biopsies and a stereotactic for microcalcifications and 1 nodule in the R breast and 2 nodules in the L, all turned out b9 except one nodule on the L.  Now, I am waiting on my first breast MRI this coming Fri to check out a suspicious nodule in R breast again.  I completely understand how terrified you are but everyone here is giving you good advice..80% of calcifications are B9.  I do suggest you get a copy of your report tho..I am really big on that and always try to get copies of everything.  Also, my needle biopsies left barely visible scars.  My breast surgeon was looking for them last week and could barely see them.  If you have a choice, I think that's the way to go if you're concerned about scarring.  Best of luck and take it one day at a time!
